Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: வறியார்க்கொன்று ஈவதே ஈகைமற் றெல்லாம்குறியெதிர்ப்பை நீர துடைத்து.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: To give to the destitute is true charity. All other gifts have the nature of (what is done for) a measured return.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is shown giving a gift to a truly destitute and poor person ('வறியார்க்கு'). This act is depicted as a pure, selfless, and unconditional gift. It glows with a brilliant, white light, and is labeled 'True Charity' ('ஈகை').
Layered_Composition.Midground: In contrast, another person is shown giving a gift to a wealthy peer or someone who can repay them. This act is depicted as a calculated transaction.
Layered_Composition.Background: The second gift is shown to have an invisible, spectral thread of expectation attached to it, leading back to the giver. It has the nature of seeking a 'measured return' ('குறிஎதிர்ப்பை'). This transactional gift does not glow with the pure light of true charity.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: True charity is defined as giving to the destitute with no expectation of return. All other forms of giving are merely transactions seeking a future benefit.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The glowing, pure light of true charity versus the transactional, non-glowing gift is the key visual distinction. The spectral thread of expectation clearly defines the nature of the lesser gift.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The scene of true charity is bathed in a pure, divine, white light. The scene of transactional giving is in a more mundane, neutral, and calculated light.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A comparative diptych that starkly contrasts the two types of giving.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with ethereal effects for the light of true charity and the thread of expectation.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Symbolic lighting to differentiate between pure charity and a transaction.

Cultural_Anchors: Giving to the poor is charity (வறியார்க்கு ஒன்று ஈவதே ஈகை)
All else is of the nature of seeking a return (மற்றெல்லாம் குறிஎதிர்ப்பை நீர துடைத்து)
